description:
This semester we will continue to focus on strengthening your skills in public speaking and presentations, with career-related exercises in self-presentation and job interviews.

In the first semester, students will learn and practice the fundamental skills of public speaking, including designing and delivering a range of speeches (demonstrative, impromptu, informative, persuasive); controlling nervousness; using resources; and polishing delivery. Students will be required to evaluate classmates’ speeches as well as their own. Once in the semester, students are required to attend a local Toastmasters’ meeting and write a report on the meeting (details on this to be announced).
goals: To help students learn effective techniques to control nervousness
To help students learn the art of mind-mapping, brainstorming, and outlining
To help student learn how to critique many presentations
syllabus:
**Public Speaking: Presentation Skills**

National Taiwan Normal University, Spring 2017

Mondays, 12:20-14:10

Dr. Justin Prystash                                                

Office:     720                

Office Hours: M 15:20-16:10; W 12:20-13:10; F 12:20-14:10

Email: jprystash@ntnu.edu.tw or jprystash@hotmail.com        

**Course Description**

This course focuses on strengthening your skills in public speaking and presentations. The best way to strengthen these skills is to exercise them, so students will give speeches or presentations every week.

**Attendance**

Students are expected to regularly attend and participate in class. If you have an emergency and will be absent for one of your speeches or presentations, you must contact me (ahead of time, if possible) so we can reschedule. If you don’t contact me, you will receive a zero on the speech.

**Speeches and Presentations**

Students will give several speeches and presentations over the course of the semester. I will score the following aspects of each speech – poise, voice, life, eye contact, gestures, and speed – and I will provide written feedback and guidance to each speaker along with their scores.
